Login

  • Usage guidelines
  • Basic login form
  • Centered login form

Usage Guidelines

The Login component is a specific kind of form that allows users to provide their credentials to the system in order to access its data, content, tools, or services. Its sole purpose is to be the gateway to a system and requires accurate input or it will not allow access. Logins should always provide a method for the user to recover their username and password (even if is simply a link to contact their IT admin).

Do

  • Use when user credentials are required for access to a system
  • Offer option to remember user on that computer
  • Offer secure password re-set option
  • When credentials fail, tell user which credential - user name or password - they got wrong
  • Adjust keyboard for mobile when logging in via a mobile device

Don't

  • Use for featured content

Basic login form

The login component provides a standard way to present users with a login form for your application.

Nexxus

Forgot password

Centered login form

Include the optional .login-container around the login form to center it vertically and horizontally on the page.

Nexxus

Forgot password
